verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; set to Al-tashheth. A Psalm of David. Michtam. Do ye indeed <WH552> in silence <WH482> speak <WH1696> righteousness <WH6664>? Do ye judge <WH8199> uprightly <WH4339>, O ye sons <WH1121> of men <WH120>?
Nay <WH3820>, in heart ye work <WH6466> wickedness <WH5766>; Ye weigh <WH6424> out the violence <WH2555> of your hands <WH3027> in the earth <WH776>.
The wicked <WH7563> are estranged <WH2114> from the womb <WH7358>: They go astray <WH8582> as soon as they are born <WH990>, speaking <WH1696> lies <WH3577>.
Their poison <WH2534> is like <WH1823> the poison <WH2534> of a serpent <WH5175>: They are like the deaf <WH2795> adder <WH6620> that stoppeth <WH331> her ear <WH241>,
Which hearkeneth <WH8085> not to the voice <WH6963> of charmers <WH3907>, Charming <WH2266> never so wisely <WH2449>.
Break <WH2040> their teeth <WH8127>, O God <WH430>, in their mouth <WH6310>: Break out <WH5422> the great teeth <WH4459> of the young lions <WH3715>, O Jehovah <WH3068>.
Let them melt away <WH3988> as water <WH4325> that runneth apace <WH1980>: When he aimeth <WH1869> his arrows <WH2671>, let them be as though they were cut off <WH4135>.
Let them be as a snail <WH7642> which melteth <WH8557> and passeth away <WH1980>, Like the untimely birth <WH5309> of a woman <WH802>, that hath not seen <WH2372> the sun <WH8121>.
Before your pots <WH5518> can feel <WH995> the thorns <WH329>, He will take them away with a whirlwind <WH8175>, the green <WH2416> and the burning alike <WH2740>.
The righteous <WH6662> shall rejoice <WH8055> when he seeth <WH2372> the vengeance <WH5359>: He shall wash <WH7364> his feet <WH6471> in the blood <WH1818> of the wicked <WH7563>;
So that men <WH120> shall say <WH559>, Verily there is a reward <WH6529> for the righteous <WH6662>: Verily there is <WH3426> a God <WH430> that judgeth <WH8199> in the earth <WH776>.
